intro: Acmispon brachycarpus, commonly known as yellow vetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a trailing growth habit and produces small, elliptical seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Acmispon brachycarpus is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
